    • Method Detail

      • authenticate

        public static boolean authenticate(byte[] salt,
                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> originals,
                   java.util.List<byte[]> encrypted)
                            throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                   java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Verifies that each of the Strings in 'originals' match the decrypted byte[] in 'encrypted' with the same index. The default algorithm 'PBKDF2WithHmacSHA1' is used.
        Parameters:
        salt - The salt used to encrypt the string initially.
        originals - The original strings that must be tested for authenticity.
        encrypted - The encrypted strings to match.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException

      • authenticate

        public static boolean authenticate(java.lang.String original,
                   byte[] encrypted,
                   byte[] salt)
                            throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                   java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Verifies that the String 'original' is the original representation for the byte[] 'encrypted' using the default algorithm PBKDF2WithHmacSHA1.
        Parameters:
        original - The original string that must be tested for authenticity.
        encrypted - The encrypted string to match.
        salt - The salt used to encrypt the string initially.
        Returns:
        if the original is the decrypted String representation of 'encrypted' and false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException

      • authenticate

        public static boolean authenticate(java.lang.String original,
                   byte[] encrypted,
                   byte[] salt,
                   EncryptionService.EncryptionAlgorithm alg)
                            throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                   java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Verifies that the String 'original' is the original representation for the byte[] 'encrypted'.
        Parameters:
        original - The original string that must be tested for authenticity.
        encrypted - The encrypted string to match.
        salt - The salt used to encrypt the string initially.
        alg - The encryption algorithm used to encrypt the string initially.
        Returns:
        true if the original is the decrypted String representation of 'encrypted' and false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException

      • decrypt

        public static byte[] decrypt(byte[] encryptedVersion,
             byte[] rawSaltKey)
        Decrypts a String encrypted encrypted by the encrypt(String, Key) function.
        Parameters:
        encryptedVersion - The encrypted string
        rawSaltKey - The byte[] representation of the Key used in encryption.
        Returns:
        The decrypted String.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        java.io.IOException

      • decrypt

        public static byte[] decrypt(byte[] encryptedVersion,
             java.security.Key salt)
        Decrypts a String encrypted encrypted by the encrypt(String, Key) function.
        Parameters:
        encryptedVersion - The encrypted string
        keyData - The byte[] representation of the Key used in encryption.
        Returns:
        The decrypted String.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException

                     byte[] salt)
                              throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                     java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Encrypts the String original to a byte[] using the salt and the default Algorithm PBKDF2WithHmacSHA1.
        Parameters:
        toEncrypt - The original string that must be tested for authenticity.
        salt - The salt used to encrypt the string initially.
        Returns:
        The encrypted byte[].
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException

                     byte[] salt,
                     EncryptionService.EncryptionAlgorithm alg)
                              throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                     java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Encrypts the String original to a byte[] using the salt and algorithm passed in the parameters
        Parameters:
        toEncrypt - The original string that must be tested for authenticity.
        salt - The salt used to encrypt the string initially.
        alg - The encryption algorithm to use.
        Returns:
        The encrypted byte[].
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
